show.subtitle: Your Economic Survival?  They're Not Looking Out For You.  We are.
show.title: The Wake Up Call

title: No Stopping The Military-Industrial Complex…
content:
War is, indeed, a racket – at $800 billion a year (the same as the entire federal budget in 1983). The U.S. <!--more--> spends more on war than the next thirteen countries combined.
They lie about the costs.
The Nobel “Peace-Prize” president in no such animal.
War spending grew to $879 billion by 2011, a 164% increase in thirteen years.
Worldwide bullying is an expensive hobby.
Progress is sometimes surprisingly absent from our daily lives.
Greenspan’s faulty view of everything as expressed in his book.
Greece still borrowing money while broker than ever.
Quick stock market comment.
U.
S taxes its non-resident citizens and criticizes another country for doing exactly the same thing!
The speculative mania at the Souk at Mamakh in Abu Dhabi.
